title: New Client Resize/Move Bug?
body:
My monitor is small so the new client doesn't fit it correctly. When I try to move the client to the center of my screen, the part of the client that I couldn't see before vanishes. Help please?

Edit: Some pics that might help - http://imgur.com/a/eH9BE

replies.body:
You can resize the client's size *on the fly* by holding down **CTRL** and hitting **+** to increase the size or **-** to decrease the size.

Let me know if this helped. ^.^

> [{quoted}](name=Targons Blade,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=r2mdWGnN,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2016-11-14T23:55:17.365+0000)
>
> You can resize the client's size *on the fly* by holding down **CTRL** and hitting **+** to increase the size or **-** to decrease the size.
> 
> Let me know if this helped. ^.^

my max size is 1280x720 in settings (and 1024x768) while I have 1600x900. Is it possible to add more resolutions to alpha client?
Unfortunately, there's not. The choices scale off your display's resolution.

> [{quoted}](name=Targons Blade,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=r2mdWGnN,comment-id=000200000000,timestamp=2016-11-15T22:12:32.682+0000)
>
> Unfortunately, there's not. The choices scale off your display's resolution.

My display resolution is 1600x900. I can't select 1600x900 in alpha client, while i saw some people posted screenshot where they have THREE resolutions to select: 1024x768, 1280x720 and 1600x900. 

I have only two - 1024x768 and 1280x720

The Alpha Client cannot be fullscreened, and the players that have 1600x900 have that option because they're running a higher-resolution display such as 1920x1080 or 2560x1440.

I hope that clears up the confusion.

Why that "tier-less resolution" is a thing at all? Why not let us to have "1600x900 minus 10% scaling" for example?

Desktop > Right-Click > Screen Resolution
